website_summaries.verdict: Silicone ice cube trays have several advantages over plastic or metal, and these from Tovolo are very versatile. Could also be used for candle making, soap making, or other crafts.
pros: Takes little effort to remove cubes
cons: Each compartment needs to filled individually, not the common "overflow" technique

customer_reviews.title: I wanted it to work but....
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of these in the freezer for years and I found that the ice was increasingly foul tasting. So I ordered a new pair of trays and that's when I found the problem. It wasn't the freezer. It's the TRAYS. When they arrived, they stank right out of the package, and the package stated we could wash in vinegar and water. Well, that was a waste of vinegar AND water. I sent them back. I simply do not want my scotch to taste like chemicals and these trays impart that flavor to the cubes. Bad.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: I needed smaller ice cube trays to fit ice cubes into my wide mouth water bottles for work. These have been great so far. Yes, they are rather difficult to remove but my old plastic ones ended up snapping in my hands over time so at least there is no worry that that will happen with these. I have not noticed any funky tastes as some of the other reviews have reported. I have the grey ones. Maybe it has to do with the different colored trays as far as dyes or something. I do wish they were a little easier to refill. I have to pull out a small measuring glass with a spout to refill them every time.
customer_reviews.author: Fiercefoxie

customer_reviews.title: Hate it, spills water everywhere.
customer_reviews.text: These are the worst, most flimsy ice cube trays I’ve ever used. No way you’re getting it into the freezer without spilling water everywhere. There’s no stiff reinforcement around the edges, so the thing wobbles like jello when there’s water in it. Even the cheapest silicone cube trays will have something holding them in shape. This is basically a thin silicone mold. Not stable at all.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hassan

customer_reviews.title: Great cubes/tricky to release.
customer_reviews.text: I love the size, shape and density of the ice cubes. The shape of the trays firs small freezer area well. But I haven’t figured out an easy way to pop the ice out. Getting better but fingers always frozen by the time I’m done and have broken a couple nails too. I’m sure there’s an easy method, I just don’t know what it is! That said, still worth it cause the cubes are ideal.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: A great solution
customer_reviews.text: Makes perfectly shaped cubes. The silicone is flexible enough to bend and push cubes out from the other side. Vastly superior to using the old-fashioned hard plastic ice cube trays! To keep freshly loaded ice trays level on my wire freezer shelves, I place them on a small metal tray (from my toaster oven). I got this pair of ice cube trays specifically to freeze lemon juice from my lemon tree produce. I then store the cubes in freezer zip bags to use in salad dressing instead of vinegar, or to liven up a glass of mineral water on a hot day.
customer_reviews.author: birdmaze

customer_reviews.title: Just what an Ice Cube Tray should be, nothing more.
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent. Well made, not too big, not too small. Right out of the package, just a quick hot water rinse, fill them up and pop them in the freezer a few hours later, MAGIC! First the BAD NEWS...there is NO bad news! Ice cubes pop right out, no mixed-martial arts grappling (sorry if you're into that). Easy to find in a packed freezer, you will NOT be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: 7SFCW4

customer_reviews.title: Virtually perfect
customer_reviews.text: I haven't run into an issue yet. I use them to craft laundry pods. After a hundred or so they still release well and show no sign of wear. I can't think of any downside to these unless you consider the price or color? Both are minor details.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.text: The ice cubes this tray makes are the perfect size to fit into 90 percent of cups and due to the larger size will not melt as fast as regular fridge ice maker ice. I always keep a few trays ready to go for cocktail making. There also great for using in a cocktail shaker when making something like a Whisky Sour which can benefit from the extra aeration.
customer_reviews.author: Dino

customer_reviews.title: Worked great. I cooked up batches and batches of veggies
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these so I could make and freeze my own baby food. Worked great.I cooked up batches and batches of veggies, pureed them - some with breast milk for consistency sake, then froze in these perfect little cubes. I froze these covered with some plastic wrap, then once solid popped them out into a ziplock bag. Makes it easy to mix veggies if needed. Because its silicone, it was super easy to get out, you just push from the bottom, or twist. No issues with tearing, or quality. I even used them to make decorative fruit filled ice cubs for a party.
customer_reviews.author: Chevy BlueTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Very hard to remove cubes
customer_reviews.text: A good ice cube tray is simple. It makes pretty squares, it holds well, and it's easy to remove. Sadly these are infuriatingly hard to remove from the tray, you have to really bend them and your hands will get frozen in the process. I would not recommend these and wish I had bought another tray instead.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Mar

customer_reviews.title: Baby it's cold inside that freezer!
customer_reviews.text: When reading other reviews the major complaint was getting the cubes out of the tray. I have to agree at first but as they have been used more and more they seem to come out pretty well. My wife and I are happy with the size of the cube and the sturdiness of the silicon tray. They don't dip to one side and spill like others we have experienced. Well constructed this item does what it is supposed to do. Freeze ice.
customer_reviews.author: Dutch M.

customer_reviews.title: Perhaps best used to freeze liquids for later use vs everyday ice cubes bc of work to get cubes out of trays
customer_reviews.text: They are as described, though not exceptional in any way that impressed me. Not sure what I was expecting, perhaps that the ice cubes would pop out easily. But because of the depth compared to other dimensions, I had to really work the cubes out. However, they do not stick to the sides of the tray. Perhaps if just filling every other spot it might be easier to dislodge cubes, didn't try that yet. Where I do see the merit of using these is if you want to freeze liquid ingredients in small portions for later use. You'll have a nice uniform size to melt more evenly in the microwave and will stack nicely in a freezer container or ziplock.
customer_reviews.author: angelluv

customer_reviews.title: Not as easy to use as I had hoped
customer_reviews.text: After ready way more reviews of ice cube trays that any reasonable person ever should, I decided on these Tovolo trays in lime green. I have to say that I love the color, and I like that they are bpa-free, which was my biggest priority. They do, however, have some shortcomings that have been mentioned by others: 1) the cubes can be difficult to remove. Are they worse trays out there? yes, but these take a bit more effort than a good quality hard plastic tray that you bend to release the ice; and 2) they are small. On the plus side, they make very beautiful ice, so if that is your priority, these will definitely do that.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Love these trays. Iced coffee, adult beverages
customer_reviews.text: Was skeptical about the negative reviews, but tried them anyway. I am very sensitive to smells, and found absolutely none in this product. Cubes taste as good as the water used to make them. I even go back and forth between freezing water and coffee in them. They don't hold or transfer odors or taste. They are tricky to de mold. Turn upside down in your sink. Run warm water over the back for a reward seconds, and flex the trays both directions. Use your thumbs to push them out into a bowl or directly into your glass. Ordering another set now.
customer_reviews.author: brian hammett

customer_reviews.title: Takes a lot of effort to get the ice cubes out.
customer_reviews.text: The trays are smaller than they look from the picture. It's actually really hard to get the ice cubes out of these and I can definitely see they are wearing down. We stopped using them because they were simply more of a pain than they were worth. On the other hand, the ice cubes they made were significantly larger than the ones made by our fridge and we needed a lot fewer in our drinks. For special purpose cubes (like for whisky) I could see breaking these out again, but not for normal day-to-day usage.
customer_reviews.author: SLav

customer_reviews.title: Makes nice ice cubes.
customer_reviews.text: I love the perfect squares. I love the blue color of the tray and the silicone feel. They take a small amount of room in the freezer and make a lot of cubes. My only problem is that they are hard to push out of the tray.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Farrington

customer_reviews.title: Best Ice cube tray!
customer_reviews.text: Favorite ice cube trays EVER! I always have people ask what kind of ice cube tray makes perfect cubes like this. At the time I could not find a tray like this locally, now however they can be found in a few stores around the local mall. Still it was a good buy as these are cheaper. Im not sure if it is the quality of my water but over the few years Ive had them they have developed a "smell" about them. Washing them doesn't help and my wife swears she can taste it in the ice, I however cannot.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin M Shireman

customer_reviews.title: great trays for homemade baby food
customer_reviews.text: I made my own baby food theses trays were GREAT!! I would puree the vegies and freeze them in these then plae each cube in a fold type sandwhich bag and place all of them in a gallon size freezer bag (dated and labled). I really liked these because of the size they are 1 oz cubes (almost a perfect square). made it super easy to take out the right amount. would HIGHLY recommend ( I have to many moms I know) the only complait I have is I wish they had lids, I used the cling type universal covers (the ones that look like shower caps) worked well enough I would wash and reuse them also
customer_reviews.author: Christina G.

customer_reviews.title: Makes a perfect cube
customer_reviews.text: I have a few products by Trovolo, and like the others, this is a Great product. The ice cubes that this makes are a perfect size, and look great in a glass. They also dissolve a little slower then other cubes which means it lasts a little longer in your drink, another words if you usually use 2 or 3 regular cubes, you may be fine with just 1 of these cubes. The tray is easy to fill, just be careful moving it to the freezer, and once frozen they pop out easy with a little press to the bottom of the tray under the cube. I have had good comments when pouring guests a drink too.
customer_reviews.author: pennrj430

customer_reviews.title: Flexible, tough, clean easily.
customer_reviews.text: Flexible, tough, clean easily. The 1 inch cubes are perfect for making my Jameson and Cokes in my lowball glasses. Cubes take some effort to push them out through the bottom of the tray and sometimes your skin will stick to the trays while you are pushing out ice cubes, ouch! Overall, I enjoy using the ice trays and I feel they will last for quite a spell. I did not notice any odd flavors or smells in the ice. I washed the trays, air dried them, and put them in use.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these and have been using the for a year. To get the cubes out i simply bend the tray so they push out a bit, then pull them out or push from the back with my thumbs if need be. People have complained about smells, but never encountered an issue. i have these kept in a freezer along with frozen fish food for a saltwater tank which consists of individual packages of shrimp, clams, and at one point silversides. Not even the slightest smell or flavor has tainted these. A must have along with their other tray molds.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy

customer_reviews.title: I love these! I will be ordering more
customer_reviews.text: I love these! I will be ordering more. I put fresh chopped herbs in them and fill with olive oil. Freeze and then put the cubes in Ziplock bags. Great to take one, two or how ever many you want out and put them in soups, gravy or add to veggies while roasting with a chicken or roast. Pop them right in the dishwasher top rack! Love these.
customer_reviews.author: Beemergranny

customer_reviews.title: Read the 1 star reviews.
customer_reviews.text: These were going to replace our ice trays which were breaking. Just like most of the 1 star reviews report, the trays exchange a disgusting taste from the silicone to the ice cubes. I washed them with extremely hot water and 91% alcohol but the scent is still there and will transfer to the cubes if I use them again. I'm trying some completely different ice trays now. :(
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Awesome ice cube trays!
customer_reviews.text: I picked these up when my old hard plastic ones started to shatter. They are amazing! They make ice into 1oz cubes which are pretty cool. Some other people have complained that you can't "pop" all of the ice out once, and have to remove the cubes one at a time. Well, this saves them ending up on the floor and they never freeze up in the tray so you can't remove them. Also they are BPA free, so what's not to love? They come 2 in a pack which makes for some 30 cubes, I may pick up some more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Whil

customer_reviews.title: Strong odor and difficult to pop the ice cubes out
customer_reviews.text: I like the small size which means it won't take up much room in the freezer, however it has a plastic odor and once you fill the try up because the squares are deep and the division lines are all even meaning it fills up to the division line it is difficult to pop the ice out. Also if you want to stack on top of each other again because it is completely even on top if you put one tray on top of the other they will touch. Sorry if the explanation is confusing but with the old style trays there is always a bit of space to work with not with these.
customer_reviews.author: sunny

customer_reviews.title: Yaaay and nay
customer_reviews.text: A little difficult to remove ice, but seems sturdy and like it will last for a while. Ice cubes come out perfectly, just take a while
customer_reviews.author: nclayman

customer_reviews.title: A different and better ice tray.
customer_reviews.text: My roommate in grad school had a set like these and I loved them. I don't recall what brand they were but they were similar. I loved them because I hated messing with the plastic trays to get ice out, and sometimes they develop a smell. I've also broken some plastic trays in my time so I have a severe dislike for them. I love these silicone trays, they make nice sized cubes and the ice is easyish to get out. Four stars because the silicone is kind of stiff right away, making it kinda tough to bust out some cubes, which I hope will ease up with age. But a great buy and great to get when on sale.
customer_reviews.author: JRH

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love these. Now when I need ice I can get the amount of cubes I want without a bunch of other cubes falling out too.
customer_reviews.author: Edrie James

customer_reviews.title: Someone built a better mousetrap, I mean ice cube tray
customer_reviews.text: Ever since I was a child and was tormented by those old aluminum ice cube trays with the lever running down the middle, I have had a deep-seated hatred of ice cube trays. Even some of the more modern versions were disappointing because their longevity was so short. These trays are both versatile and easy to use. Versatile because my wife has found that she can freeze anything in these trays and there is no possibility of sticking (she freezes various stocks, coconut milk, etc, that she uses in small portions). Easy to use because you can remove one cube without disturbing the rest of the tray.
customer_reviews.author: DesertYak

customer_reviews.title: Love the square cubes but hard to get them out
customer_reviews.text: I love the square cubes and like that they seem bigger and nicer than regular old rectangular cubes. I do have two issues though. First, because this is silicone and not rigid plastic it must really be supported when moving it to the freezer or it will spill. Second, the cubes are really difficult to remove from the tray. Normally we empty a whole tray at a time into another container and while some cubes come out easy (the ones in the middle), it is a lot of work to get the others out. Because the process takes a while i have to hold the tray with a towel to keep my hand from freezing.
customer_reviews.author: C. Jorbin

customer_reviews.title: Highly functional
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant but the silicone holds it shape well, makes well formed square ice cubes and moves easily to remove the number of ice cubes you want without removing more than needed. And they are pretty.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Oakes

customer_reviews.title: Only usable for water
customer_reviews.text: I like to freeze tea so I have undiluted tea when I brew some and turn it to iced tea. The tea cubes stick and are hard to get out, but water comes out just fine, though you have to handle each cube separately to get them out (pushing them out from the back side, instead of just giving a twist of a plastic ice tray where they will all pop out. Nice that I don't have to run water over the back side to get these cubes out, though, which you sometimes have to do with the plastic trays (or use brute strength and break the plastic as well...lol).
customer_reviews.author: Over 50 and Lovin' It

customer_reviews.title: see review
customer_reviews.text: quite satisfied however they do have an odor so I have four of these and I use one at a time, and I have a rotation first in, first out. whenever one is dirty it goes in the dishwasher. You might also just add a baking soda box to your freezer...and change as necessary. i am just wondering whether these are phthalate free...as they are flexible plastic.... Sturdy, had for a couple of years no issues. Also have the extra large cubes, great for sipping alcohol.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect cubes ...
customer_reviews.text: Really surprising product ... perfect cubes created. A scothch with a perfect cube is a beautiful thing.
customer_reviews.author: SPRINT MAFIA

customer_reviews.title: easy to remove, not so much
customer_reviews.text: Even with an attempt of just popping one out, there is too much effort that has to go into it. As i read in another review, not for the need it now, twist and go group. The easiest way (by easiest i dont imply it is completely easy) to remove the cubes was to fill the sink with an inch or two of warm water, set them in for a minute and then work to get them out. Yes, still work. Now true, they are the perfect cube; however, I wouldnt purchase these again. Thought two, mini jello molds... hey, it may have a use afterall.
customer_reviews.author: Momma-shopper

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for freezing home made baby food!
customer_reviews.text: We bought these trays to freeze our son's home made baby food. They are perfect for making one ounce portions. The silicon material is flexible without tearing, but getting the food out can be a little tough. In addition, they do take a little extra care when cleaning since they are not dishwasher safe. We own four total so it's perfect when making multiple batches of food. So if you're in the market for one ounce trays for baby food, I would highly recommend these. Only reason I didn't give five stars is because of the work it takes to get them clean.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Nice ice trays, but packaging ruined it
customer_reviews.text: I got these because I wanted to make perfect ice cubes, however, they are not as easy to use as described. While the walls feel pretty sturdy, the way it was packaged ruined the perpendicular walls, so you end up with slanted cubes. It's unfortunate that mediocre packaging ruined a pretty good product, but I guess that's not the first time it has happened. There might be a way to fix it, but I haven't had time to look into it yet.
customer_reviews.author: PLinTop Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: Cannot get the ice out of the trays
customer_reviews.text: I bought these ice cube trays for my 85 year old mother. She was having a problem with twisting the hard plastic trays with her weak wrists. I bought them for a Christmas present. Why I did not look at all reviews firs I do not know. I just called and asked her if she had used the trays yet. She said yes, but no one(ages at the house that tried was from 85 down to 40, 6 adults) could get the ice out of the trays. Unbelievable. Really? These should be an easy twist and the cubes drop out. I would not buy these again nor recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Jilbert

customer_reviews.title: Right Size
customer_reviews.text: I love the size of cubes they make and the soft rubber this product id made of. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall

customer_reviews.title: should've listened to the reviews
customer_reviews.text: They were fine for a couple of weeks and then started making my water taste like a chemical bath. Absolutely disgusting. Total waste of money, can't use. Too bad the return window closed. I don't think I even had these for a month before they started making everything completely undrinkable. DON'T BUY!
customer_reviews.author: LJ16

customer_reviews.title: Better than plastic
customer_reviews.text: Really like how these are not plastic. I use these cubes for blending, and pop them out into the blender to make blended ice. It takes about 2 cups of water to fill them up. They are a bit of a pain to get the ice out compared to traditional plastic ice trays, but after some trial and error, I have a technique that works well. I have not experienced smelly ice/trays like others have said. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: coolnames

customer_reviews.title: Tovolo Perfect Cube Ice Tray, Set of 2,
customer_reviews.text: These hold 2 fewer cubes than my old trays but they also fit better in the fridge. The others were long and take up all the space, front to back. These are not as long and leave extra room. They also have flat bottoms so you can stack one on the other. My older trays couldn't sit so well on top of each other. The tray is very flexible and cubes pop out. My older trays were getting stiff and had to wrench them around to remove the cubes. These are new and don't know how they do in the long run, but especially love the smaller footprint.
customer_reviews.author: Happy

customer_reviews.title: Good size
customer_reviews.text: Easy to clean and stable in the freezer. The cubes are a little tough to remove but if I let them sit for a few min then remove them it is much easier.
customer_reviews.author: k8wma

customer_reviews.title: Ice Cube Trays - Everyone needs em'!
customer_reviews.text: It's incredibly difficult to find non standard ice cube trays in stores. Who knew? I saw these in a magazine for fancy flavored ice cubes so I bought them, but never made the ice cubes. Oh well. I do use them for regular cubes though and they do make pretty little cubed ices....cubes. But they are kind of hard to get out of the tray. Maybe I'm doing something wrong. But they are very sturdy. I thought they would fold over or something when filled with water, but they stay rigid along the bottom and do work really well. I would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Foxtrot Sierra

customer_reviews.title: Perfect cubes, easy release
customer_reviews.text: Other reviewers have lamented that cubes are difficult to remove from silicone trays. Certainly the cubes take a little more time to remove* than twist-n-crack hard plastic trays, but I feel it is well-worth it as I expect these will last much longer ( my last set of hard plastic trays lasted fewer than 6 months before cracking! ) and the cubes are great. These (in contrast, I think, to some other silicone trays) are easy to carry flat from the sink to the freezer, which is nice. *The trick to removing the cubes is to push the center row out first; the edge rows will then come out much easier and faster.
customer_reviews.author: J. Blachly

customer_reviews.title: I don’t believe I would recommend these  trays because of the difficulty in removing the ice cubes.
customer_reviews.text: If it wasn’t such a hassle I would return these in a heartbeat. The ice cubes are extremely difficult to remove. Definitely not what I had in mind when I was thinking convenience. I thought because of the size they would work in our rv refrigerator freezer.
customer_reviews.author: Mary S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Cubes Every Time
customer_reviews.text: I moved into a home from a home w/a fridge w/an icemaker to one w/out. I needed Ice trays & no store had any! The one's I did find broke whenever you tried to crack the ice. So I purchased these. For their price, I figured these better be the "Mercedes Benz" of Ice Trays. Well, they are perfect, EXCEPT, when you do need to crack the ice, they're so cold & a little difficult to manage - especially getting the cubes out at the corners since there's nothing to grip onto to do this, so you are gripping the cold frosted outside of them to get the cubes out. A little uncomfortable, but perfect squared cubes every time.
customer_reviews.author: carly

customer_reviews.title: Frozen Baby Food
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for making frozen baby food. They have been working great, easy to fill and easy to remove the cubes once frozen.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Freel

customer_reviews.title: The Best......
customer_reviews.text: ice trays I have every bought, owned & used!!!! I'm glad I purchased these ice trays. The cubes slip right out when you push them up from the bottom. They don't stick, you don't have to twist or smack and you don't have to run the bottom under some water to loosen them. We don't have an ice maker in our freezer so when I broke down and admitted I needed ice trays instead of buying bags of ice from the store I looked for days on various sites before settling on these. I'm glad I got them and I would recommend them to anyone needing ice trays.
customer_reviews.author: kangas3

customer_reviews.title: Great for clarified butter cubes
customer_reviews.text: I alway feel a little silly giving such high marks to something so elementary but these ice cube trays are perfect for my purposes which is making as storing clarified butter. I pour the clarified butter into the trays, freeze them immediately and then take the cubes out and store them in a freezer bag. The cube size is just about right for every job and clarified butter is such a nice thing to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Junker

customer_reviews.title: decent, but a few issues
customer_reviews.text: These are decent trays for making a lot of squares of ice. The only downsides are: -it is difficult to remove cubes and takes a bit of time, as you have to do it one at a time -there is a weird white residue on cubes that comes out in drinks. I have washed this tray and used it about 20 times and it still happens. I am not sure what it is. I have googled it and found others that complain about it, but no one knows what it is. I worry that is not good for me and am tempted to stop using these trays except for cooler ice.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for making cocktails at home
customer_reviews.text: Can be a little finicky but that goes with any silicone mold, honestly probably one of the easier ice trays I’ve used. Originally bought these because I wanted to use bar style ice for making cocktails at home. These glasses perfectly fit the bill. Maybe it’s just my freezer/water but the ice isn’t completely cloudy either so that’s also a plus
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Perez

customer_reviews.title: Nice, Big Ice Cubes, Easy to Remove
customer_reviews.text: These trays work beautifully, and the ice is super easy to get out! The cubes are huge as well, requiring less per drink, which is nice. Only issue is they are so big they may not fit in some portable containers, but that does not detract from the overall value of this product!
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Terrible plastic/ammonia taste seeps into ice after 1 month of use
customer_reviews.text: The trays made nicely sized cubes, and they were not too difficult to get out. However, after 1 month of intensive use (with filtered water), the trays started imparting strong plastic taste/aftertaste to the ice. The taste was very powerful, to the extent of making taste of, say, Coca Cola completely unrecognizable. There is also a perceptible hint of ammonia in the smell of ice. Whatever it is these trays are leaking, it can't be good for your health. We're throwing these away and not recommending ANYONE to use them.
customer_reviews.author: SRPro

customer_reviews.title: funny residue
customer_reviews.text: Like some other reviews,the tray is wabbly to fill up.But my main problem is the residue.Something is strange with these trays.Do this test...take your regular ice from your original trays and use that ice in water(clear glass),then do the same with these silicone tray ice cubes.(allow the cubes to melt and carefully examine the water in both glasses).what is all the stuff floating around in the water from the silicone tray's cubes?AND YES I WASHED THE TRAYS CAREFULLY BEFORE USE.WHAT A WASTE OF MONEY.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: amazing- easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: These ice cube trays are great. Recently moved to a new place with out an ice maker. I always hated using ice cube trays because of the mess they make. The hard plastic ones seem to send ice cubes and shards of ice everywhere. These DO Not do that. In fact it is easy to push one cube out from the bottom. I also like the square cube shape, it makes the drinks look more appealing. The size of the tray isn't too large, I was afraid they would be floppy when filled with water and might make a mess, they are easy to handle when unfrozen as well.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Beckerle

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Freezing Homemade Baby Food
customer_reviews.text: I use these to freeze homemade baby food. The silicone material makes it very easy to pop the solid cubes out once they are frozen and store them in freezer bags. The 1 oz cubes are very easy to thaw and make it simple for me to stay on top of how much baby is eating at a time. Thanks to these I was able to keep the freezer stocked with all types of fruit, vegetable and meat purees for all baby's meals and since she was eating home-cooked food all along the transition to table food was very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Erika A.

customer_reviews.title: Great Ice Cube Trays!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My mom and dad had a set of these, and my dad complained that the ice cubes did not come out easily. My dad complains about everything. I bought a set of these, and love them!! They make the coolest looking ice cubes, and are virtually indestructible. I clean mine with a spray of hydrogen peroxide. If you try to push the cubes out as soon as you take these out of the freezer, then yes, dad, they stick. Not a lot, just a little. But if you set them on the counter, wait a little bit, then they slide right out!!
customer_reviews.author: Can't Hit Nothing

customer_reviews.title: Finally! An ice cube tray worth writing about.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a tray that made larger cubes for some of my drinks. These trays were perfect. They fit nicely into the little mini-fridge I have under my bar, their flexible construct makes the cubes easy to remove, and the large size cubes were just what I'd hoped for. I would absolutely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Ice Cubes
customer_reviews.text: I have several Tovolo ice cube trays, they all work perfectly....buy these, you won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Film and funny taste
customer_reviews.text: I thought I'd take a chance on these trays based on what I'd read. I wanted to use them for cocktail ice, old fashioned, margaritas etc. When finished with the drink you'll notice an odd hazy looking film on the outside of the glass, and I can't imagine that is good for you to be drinking. It's too bad because the cubes are the perfect size and are easy to remove.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Wojciak

customer_reviews.title: This tray will hold one ounce of liquid per square.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to freeze coconut oil in one ounce increments, and this works great. I did not need to use any grease to get the frozen oil out. It is very flexible for popping whatever out after freezing, but stable enough to not spill while carefully carrying to the freezer. It will hold one ounce of liquid per square.
customer_reviews.author: The Dog NannyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: No Good! Waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give ZERO stars I would! Sorry to say these ice trays are Awful! It is extremely difficult to remove the ice from the trays as they get stuck to the sides & hurt my hand! Garbage!
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: sturdy, and well made
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for making my chunkey chocolates. 2 cups coconut oil, a cup of coconut flakes, a cup of raisins and a 1/2 cup of organic coco powder. Put it all in a glass bowl and microwave until it all melts then give it a stir and pour into the mold and refrigerate. I leave it in the frige and pop them out of the mold when I want one
customer_reviews.author: James O. Becroft

customer_reviews.title: No Plastic, Hurray
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why anyone else got these, but I am getting away from plastic water... One comment made it sound hard to put these in the freezer, well, I ALWAYS have a flat space for my trays, even when I had plastic trays. I have four of these and grab the bunch and put them in the freezer no problem. They are a little challenging getting the cubes out, you have to individually push them out. But overall, I really like it - And I'm so glad someone is offering a plastic free tray that is better than the old metal trays.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy L. Sexton

customer_reviews.title: Lots and effective
customer_reviews.text: My cat drinks a lot of water and he likes lots of ice in it. I bought these ice cube makers because of my cat's constant demand for "ice water". I find these suit my (or rather my cat's - Kramer's) needs. Being as the pockets are so deep, I have to run hot water over the base of the tray in order to get the ice cubes out. But, with this just a little tweak, the cubes come out easily and they go straight into Kramer's water dish. My whole household is happy.
customer_reviews.author: Annette10

customer_reviews.title: Hard to get the icecubes out
customer_reviews.text: I like the shape, material (because of the lack of BPA), and color of these trays. What I didn't expect is that it is really hard, because the tray is silicone, to get the ice cubes out of the tray. Also, because the trays are silicone, it's hard to fill them and keep them level enough to return to the freezer without spilling. I now leave them in the freezer and bring the water to the freezer to fill them. In other words, there is a lot of hassle factor with these.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry W

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: This ice cube tray makes large, dense (no bubbles), cubic ice cubes that are easy to remove individually from the tray. They last much longer than ice cubes from other trays I've had. I have had no issues of flavor transfer from the silicone to the cubes, and am very happy overall with the product. The cubes are easy to remove individually without dumping out the whole tray. I could see how people would be annoyed when trying to get all the cubes out at once. In that case, you should probably get a hard-plastic tray.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Gareth

customer_reviews.title: Great ice cube trays. Perfect cubes.
customer_reviews.text: These are fun little ice cube trays. We have an old school fridge without an ice maker and we love to make cocktails. These are perfect for gin and tonics, manhattans, all your special drink needs. They are perfect cubes and look pretty in the glass. We’ve had no trouble getting them out of the tray unless you overfill.
customer_reviews.author: Mainebuyer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for homemade baby food!
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic for making homemade baby food! Each square is an ounce so it's easy to measure the food. Once full they're easy to carry and stack. They take up very little space in the freezer and they make adorable squares of food (seriously--our daycare loves the little squares). I haven't noticed a strange taste in the food (yes, I try the food I feed my babies) and it's not too difficult to get the cubes out of the trays. We're investing in a few more sets--several for baby food and several for ice. Fantastic product!
customer_reviews.author: C. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Yuck!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! After only two uses they started getting a bad smell, yuck! Only RO water touched them too. First to wash them then to put water in them. I gave two stars for them being durable. But I'm sending them back.
customer_reviews.author: inclw

customer_reviews.title: very tiny cubes, melt in a second
customer_reviews.text: It isn't clear from the ad how tiny these cubes are and thin. What happenned to regular ice cubes. I tossed it in the recycle.
customer_reviews.author: Oren F. Leblang

customer_reviews.title: Decent Ice Tray
customer_reviews.text: Great if you like square cubes ( I do), and many friends have commented on how they like them, too. The only draw back on this ice tray is that there isn't a "handle" to hold, so your fingers get ice cold really fast. I have had to set the trays down, and then return once the blood warms my fingers, otherwise I might have gotten frostbite! Would certainly by more.
customer_reviews.author: Dpoll

customer_reviews.title: Works but a bit of a hassle
customer_reviews.text: Nice ice trays but they are hard to empty. The lip around the edge makes it so you have to poke out each cube individually. I've used these types of molds for larger ice cubes but for the smaller cubes it seems to be a bit of a hassle. Still it's ice and these trays freeze water; so they work.
customer_reviews.author: S. Sellers

customer_reviews.title: Good, but $10 good? Read the reviews and decide.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Makes pretty ice cubes, breeze to clean, won't crack. Cons: Cubes reluctant as all heck to leave the nest, bit of a pain to fill. The latter is probably less an issue if you make ice with tap water; my tap water sucks so I have to fill from my water dispenser, which is not attached to the sink. From the review: "Each cube slides out without a fight." Not so much in my experience.
customer_reviews.author: A. Cordeiro

customer_reviews.title: Giant ice
customer_reviews.text: Great for get togethers with all types of drinks! Rather than having a glass full of ice that you have to screen with your teeth to get the drink out.. Why not have one giant ice cube! I works perfectly just like that. Everyone loves them. its very flexible so removing the ice is a snap.. The first time I emptied the tray, I was hesitant to really push the cube out for fear of ripping it. I quickly found out these trays are pretty tough after all! Love them
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: They work great for me
customer_reviews.text: They work great for me. I have the smallest normal fridge you can have since I live in a studio efficiency. I needed an ice tray and this works great for me. You do have to pop each cube out by pushing it out from behind, as if it were a pill in a silver packet. Interestingly, the cubes are perfectly square and would look sharp in a swanky mixed drink. I like them b/c I can stack them into my ice tray, which is really just a large piece of tupperware! ha!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... of these 5 months ago and the silicon works better than plastic trays because you can just push the ...
customer_reviews.text: I've bought 4 of these 5 months ago and the silicon works better than plastic trays because you can just push the cubes out of the silicon trays from the back with your finger instead of breaking the rigid plastic ice cubes trays we used to have to twist and bend to get a cube to pop out.
customer_reviews.author: Whale

customer_reviews.title: Because they're made of silicone, these trays are very ...
customer_reviews.text: Because they're made of silicone, these trays are very soft, and you really need a rigid board underneath them when moving them (say, transporting them to the freezer). As a result, it's kind of a pain in the gluteus to use (though that's really not the fault of the manufacturer, as they're clearly stated to be silicone). For my own convenience, I decided to go with more rigid ice trays instead.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality, Great Size!
customer_reviews.text: Love these trays, have been looking for good silicone trays for a while. They took some time to get used to, not the easiest cubes to get out of the tray at first but you get the hang of it quickly. Also, the cubes are not "perfect" as they slightly round out at the bottoms. Doesn't bother me one bit, but may be a bummer if you're looking for perfect squares (didn't detract from the review)
customer_reviews.author: Daley H.

customer_reviews.title: Great Ice!
customer_reviews.text: These ice cube trays are incredible! The ice lasts longer and the cubes are easier to remove than from regular trays. One word of caution - don't get anything on them! Any small particles stick to the silicone and are almost impossible to get off. Learned that the hard way...
customer_reviews.author: LaWhit

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Okay the ice this tray makes is beautiful, its perfect and square, looks FANTASTIC in a drink....but its extremely hard to get out of the tray, like I have to wedge it out with a butter knife hard to get out, and because its made of flexible material carrying it from sink to freezer and putting it in said freezer with out making a watery mess is impossible.
customer_reviews.author: K Smith

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Ice Cubes--Lot's of Work
customer_reviews.text: Tovolo makes pretty ice cubes. The problem is that it's a lot of work. Each cube has to be pressed out individually. This takes time and strength. It is not possible to empty the try of ice cubes all at once. One can bend the tray--which is made of rubber. But that's of no help. I would not have purchased this product if I had known about all the work you go through getting each cube out individually, one at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Kidd

customer_reviews.title: Perfect cubes indeed!
customer_reviews.text: I was worried these trays would produce cubes that were too small, but my fears were proven wrong. These are amazing trays, forming perfect cubes that last forever and make drinks look smashing. The cubes come out with a simple push on the underside of the tray. I am very picky about my cubes and these are the best I've seen. They also save space- much kinder to my small freezer than the ungainly white trays. I may throw out my two hard plastic ones and just fill my freezer with these.
customer_reviews.author: Californica

customer_reviews.title: Great for freezing baby food
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to make homemade baby food and I love it. Getting the food out isn't super easy, but easier than it was with the plastic kind, here I sometimes had to use a knife which ended up in a lot of cracked trays!! The cubes are nice squares and hold a lot for the size of the tray! I was very happy with how compact it was to fit in the freezer. I will likely buy some more.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli

customer_reviews.title: These are perfect ice cube trays
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect ice cube trays, once you get used to them. To make it easier to get the ice out, take them out of freezer and wait 5 minutes (set a timer though). Takes up less space and makes more ice than standard plastic trays that crack and break. LOVE LOVE LOVE.
customer_reviews.author: Oceankath

customer_reviews.title: SO much better than plastic
customer_reviews.text: SO much better than plastic. I've been using these for a few months now, and I will never go back. You can pop out however many ice cubes you want with minimal effort, and you don't have to worry about the tray cracking. They are silicon, so they do bend when they're empty. I just put my hand under the tray on the journey back to the freezer. Don't get these near scissors and they should last indefinitely.
customer_reviews.author: C. Martyn

customer_reviews.title: I like the idea in theory because you would think that ...
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea in theory because you would think that a silicone tray would be easy to use. Wrong! If you fill them to the top you will never be able to get them out. If you fill them half way then the cubes are just too small. They are hard to stack in the freezer too. They should have made them more narrow.
customer_reviews.author: A Harris

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: It's super hard to get the cubes out, you have to twist and pull and push to get a single cube out! I make baby food and it takes longer to unload the cubes than to make the food itself. My regular plastic ice cube trays work perfectly - one twist and they all pop out so I can put the cubes in a freezer bag. Don't waste your money on these silicone trays.
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: So easy to remove cubes
customer_reviews.text: Love this ice tray. It is so easy to remove the cubes, and the ice tray will never break. The cubes are nice squares which looks great. I'll never buy those plastic ice cube trays that crack ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not safe
customer_reviews.text: It leaches white small stuff in the water makes the water tast terrible this is not safe
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Trueblood

customer_reviews.title: Awful PRoduct
customer_reviews.text: I would return for a refund if the cost of return shipping was not almost the cost of the whole product. These Ice Cube Trays are not your standard size rather about half the normal size. I bought them thinking that silicone would make it very easy to remove the cubes. Well was that thought ever so wrong. Due to the depth of the cubes in the tray it is more difficult to remove the cubes than with a normal plastic ice cube tray. I would not recommend these to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Nice size ice cubes, pop out easily!
customer_reviews.text: These make really nice sized ice cubes and you don't have to mess around with the tray to get them to pop out. Some silicone trays get really wobbly and spill a lot of water when trying to get in the freezer, these are much more sturdy and I didn't end up with a mess on the floor!!! I even used one of the trays to make little concrete cubes for an art project and it worked great. I recommend these trays.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Dumb product.
customer_reviews.text: Dumb product....shouldn't be on the market. Big deal that they're linear cubes. It's almost impossible to get them out of the tray. It works if I run warm water on the bottom...or leave them on the counter for 10-12 minutes. Then they're of no use in an ice bucket. And who wants to PLAN to use ice cubes? Waste of time and money. Stick with the standard trays.
customer_reviews.author: Herb Decordova

customer_reviews.title: They are definitely way better than plastic ice cube trays where you practically break ...
customer_reviews.text: They are definitely way better than plastic ice cube trays where you practically break your stupid wrists trying to crack them. It's made of this like vinyl material and not plastic, and it's much easier to just press out those perfect ice cubes. You will enjoy perfectly cubical ice cubes, like you're in a restaurant or something.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Bad taste!
customer_reviews.text: I don't recommend these ice cube trays. I've had them one year now. Before I ordered I remember someone else saying there was a bad taste and I just thought it might be their water. (I have a home filtration system) I did not have that issue until now. With time there is now a horrible taste in my ice cubes. I am throwing them out. Too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Susan E

customer_reviews.title: ice ice baby
customer_reviews.text: The only ice tray type to own, the silicone trays are absolutely the best. They do not stain, hold odors, are dishwasher safe and can make so much more than ice. Try frozen yogurt cubes for the kids, homemade chocolates or make your gin and tonics with tonic cubes so they don't get watery. Try freezing egg whites for later use when you only needed to use the yolk for a recipe, or leftover soup. place cubes into a ziptop bag and store in freezer.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Ice Cubes Made Easy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these as a pair. No more pounding on the counter to remove the cubes for me. No more breaking the ice cube tray. Just give them a two handed twist to release the top overhang, and then while holding with both hands on the sides use one finger to push up and release a cube from the bottom. Stacking is no problem.
customer_reviews.author: DenS

customer_reviews.title: Ice is very hard to remove. I twisted, ...
customer_reviews.text: Ice is very hard to remove. I twisted, pokes, bent, prodded, pushed, distorted, pulled, bent etc ad nauseum. There are two reasons. First, the compartments are cubical (ie they are not narrower at the bottom). Second, and more important, ice just sticks to the silicone. The silicone is not hard and smooth. My trays are in the trash. Worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Herbert J. Ward

customer_reviews.title: Don't get them.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I (mistakenly) thought that it would be easier for me to twist them out then my conventional plastic ones. I was wrong. You cannot twist these out at all. You have to poke them out from the back one by one which makes it take 5 times longer to empty them. The color is pretty and all but so what. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: IndigoMoonArts

product_meta.title: Tovolo Perfect Cube Ice Mold Trays, Sturdy Silicone, Fade Resistant, 1.25" Cubes, Set of 2, Candy Apple Red
product_meta.description:
Size:Set of 2| Color:Candy Apple

TOVOLO PERFECT CUBE ICE TRAY 
Nothing else compares to perfectly shaped ice cubes. These durable, set of 2 silicone trays produce well-formed one inch cubes. Our silicone trays not only make ice but try freezing broth, juices, stock, baby food, and much more. Each cube slides out without a fight.

Each Perfect Cube Ice Tray measures 7 x 4.5 x 1.5 inches and can find room in any freezer. Each tray is made with bright, fun colors that are long lasting and fade resistant. The non-slip design will sit securely with spilling a drop. Trays can stack or sit alone.

FEATURES
 * Sturdy silicone construction makes a 1" perfect cube
 * Includes 2 Trays, each making 15 perfect cubes
 * Silicone trays releases the ice clean and easy
 * BPA Free, Food-Grade silicone
 * Dishwasher Safe

These cubes add perfection to every drink. Try making coffee ice cubes and never drink a diluted ice coffee again. Each Perfect Cube is easy to remove from the tray. When you pop them out the ice cubes will not spit, shard, or crack. Each cube is clean and ready for use. It's flawless. 

BENEFITS
 * A cool design with FUN colors (Red, Blue, Green, Pink)
 * Great for restaurants, bars, and in entertaining in the home
 * Makes the perfect size cube for any glass 
 * Adds a cool element to you drink

For best results, do not store ice tray in freezer, once the cube are made, remove from cubes from tray and put them in an airtight container preventing freezer odor.
feature_bullets: IMPRESSIVE ICE: Trays create perfect 1. 25-inch cubes. The durable food-grade silicone allows easy removal of one or two cubes at a time, so you can enjoy your drinks with as much ice as you want.

USER-FRIENDLY SILICONE: Durable, fade-resistant silicone lasts through many freezing cycles without becoming brittle or discoloring. Silicone makes it easy to remove as many or few cubes as you want. The food-grade silicone will not affect the taste of your ice.

MULTIPLE KITCHEN USES: Freeze juice, coffee, sauce, soup, baby food, or other leftovers to create single-serve portions. Great to use for iced coffee, smoothies, and blended cocktails. Freeze herbs, citrus slices, or berries in the ice for additional flavor infusion. Add to bar drinks, pitchers, punch, or other beverages for long-term chilling power.
EASY TO CLEAN: Trays are dishwasher safe. Rinse occasionally with water and vinegar for best results.
EASY TO CLEAN: Trays are dishwasher safe. Rinse occasionally with water and vinegar for best results.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars3,100 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
